snippet: Ferguson, Mo., which challenged parts of a pact to overhaul its police and court system, faces a lengthy, costly legal battle now that the Department of Justice has filed a civil rights suit against the municipality.
abstract: City of Ferguson, Mo, faces choice between following agreement with federal government on overhaul of Police Dept and courts, which City Council says would lead to bankruptcy, or fighting Department of Justice in civil rights suit, which could also be costly; many residents feel Council was wrong to demand changes to original consent decree.

byline.contributor: Austin Huguelet contributed reporting from Ferguson, and Matt Apuzzo from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Ferguson, Mo., which challenged parts of a pact to overhaul its police and court system, faces a lengthy, costly legal battle now that the Department of Justice has filed a civil rights suit against the municipality.

headline.main: Caught Between Costly Alternatives, Ferguson Residents Worry About Its Fate
headline.print_headline: Caught Between Costly Alternatives, Residents Worry About Ferguson’s Fate
